page.title: 01LAMBOURN VALLEY NW NEWBURY
page.content: This is a rural area lying between the A4 (Newbury to Hungerford Road) and the B4000 which follows the course of the River Lambourn. This river is a chalk stream rising on the Berkshire Downs and joining the River Kennet to the east of Newbury. Most of the land is part of the Sutton estate which has meant that the land has remained agricultural and industrial and residential development has been negligible. Approximately one third of th land is devoted to woodland and the rest is mainly mixed farmed, (arable and sheep rearing). The main settlement is the village of Stockcross which is situated in the SE corner and has a population of approximately 300. Elsewhere the population is scattered.
